title.native: フルーツバスケット 2nd Season

description:
A year has passed since Tohru Honda began living in the Souma residence, and she has since created stronger relationships with its inhabitants Shigure, Kyou, and Yuki. She has also grown closer to the rest of the Souma family and has become familiar with their ancestral secret, having helped them with many of their personal issues. The closer Tohru gets, however, the more she begins to realize that their secret holds a darker truth than she first presumed.

Summer is approaching and Tohru is invited to spend her days with the Soumas, mainly Kyou and Yuki. Tohru wishes for an easy-going vacation, but her close relationships with the two boys and the rest of the Soumas may prove to cause trouble. As they grow more intimate, their carefree time together is hindered by older hardships and feelings from the past that begin to resurface. The Eternal Banquet also dawns on the members of the zodiac, and they must tend to their duties alongside the unnerving head of the family, Akito Souma.

With the banquet approaching and a plethora of feelings to be solved, will Tohru's life with the Soumas remain peaceful, or will she find herself in a situation from which she cannot escape?
hashtag: #フルーツバスケット #フルバ #fruba #furuba
synonyms: เสน่ห์สาวข้าวปั้น ภาค 2

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Curses
tags.description: Features a character, object or area that has been cursed, usually by a malevolent supernatural force.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_takaya77)

Natsuki Takaya is a Japanese manga artist best known for creating the series Fruits Basket.

Takaya was born and raised in Tokyo, where she made her debut as a manga artist in 1992. Takaya is left handed and had wanted to be a manga artist since first grade, when her sister started drawing.

__Awards:__
* 2001: Kodansha Manga Award, Shojo : _Fruits Basket_

__Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram | Tumblr__ __Introduction:__ Charm, alternatively known as THE CHARM PARK, is a Korean-American born guitarist, vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger under record label A.S.A.B (2019–), having previously been under TOWER RECORDS (2015–2017) and rhythm zone (2018). __Biography:__ He emigrated to the US when he was 8 years old, graduating from Berklee College of Music in Boston, where he majored in Guitar. He is a former member of the band Hemenway (2011–2014).

__[Website](https://www.miyunamiyuna.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyunasinger)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLZ2RXLLVx0jAl0jxe7QzyQ)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/miyuna_miyuna/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/miyuna67/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2eg5oiMWKYEJ5vVwW1YFCC?)__

__Date of Birth:__ June 7, 2002
__Birthplace:__ Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Miyuna is a Japanese singer-songwriter affiliated with record label [A.S.A.B](https://www.asab.online/) (2019-), while having previously been under record label [Here, play pop!](http://www.playpop.org/) since her debut in 2018. 

__Biography:__
Miyuna became familiar with the rock, soul and pop genre from early childhood, which is particularily due to her parents playing western music during travels. Her parents would often listen to Whitney Houston and Michael Jackson, and as a result she became interested in soul and pop type music. She has also mentioned that her grandmother liked the artist [Hibari Misora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hibari_Misora).

In elementary school Miyuna started listening to [ONE OK ROCK](https://anilist.co/staff/126954/ONE-OK-ROCK) and became interested in rock, specifically full-fledged rock. Continuing her descent into rock, in junior high school she started listening to the rock band [coldrain](https://anilist.co/staff/105449/Coldrain), which bloomed an interest in more sub-genres of rock. She also seems to listen to various artists, regardless of genre - as an example she mentioned that she has listened to [Kouji Tamaki](https://anilist.co/staff/112133), [Toshinobu Kubota](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toshinobu_Kubota), [Ringo Shiina](https://anilist.co/staff/103213/Ringo-Shiina), the band [Petrolz](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%9A%E3%83%88%E3%83%AD%E3%83%BC%E3%83%AB%E3%82%BA) (stylized as PETROLZ), [Yu Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/116399/Yu-Takahashi), [Nakamura Emi](https://anilist.co/staff/138586/NakamuraEmi) and VOCALOID-type stuff.

She initially found success with her first two singles, "[Gamushara](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TciQvQFTzHo)" and "[Tenjou Tenge](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fZK5LKN4tek)", which were used as the fifth opening and ending theme songs to the anime [Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/Black-Clover/). Her third single, "[Boku to Kimi no Lullaby](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GH7cWANydnQ)" was used as the twenty-fifth ending theme song to the anime [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/6702/Fairy-Tail/), or alternatively known as the third ending theme song to the 2018 season of [Fairy Tail](https://anilist.co/anime/99749/Fairy-Tail-2018/), and the fourth single, "[Yurareru](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wOAz7xkukrY)", was used as the theme song for the 2019 Japanese remake of the Korean film Blind. She continues to release demos for her songs on the independent Japanese music platform Eggs.

(Source: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuna), edited)
[Website](https://ampm.tokyo/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshihide_ibata)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).
Painter turned composite artist.
Married to [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.
[Website](https://ampm.tokyo/)

He is a former member of the band Hemenway (2011–2014).

She continues to release demos for her songs on the independent Japanese music platform Eggs.

(Source: [Wikipedia (EN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuna), edited)

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Kris Roche__ is a Japanese-American born vocalist, lyricist and composer.

__[Bandcamp](https://fifileger.bandcamp.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuuri_volant) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yuurivolant/)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Fifi Léger__, alternatively known as Yuuri Volant, otherwise known as Yuuri, is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist.

[Site](https://www.monkeymajik.com) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCs9MYqANhxyLZJSkLGNx8FQ) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mm_official_)

Monkey Majik is a Japanese pop-rock band formed in 2000, consisting of two Canadian brothers ([Maynard](https://anilist.co/staff/287378/Maynard-Plant) and [Blaise Plant](https://anilist.co/staff/287377/Blaise-Plant)) and two Japanese members ([Tax](https://anilist.co/staff/287376/Tax) and Dick).  (Source: Wikipedia)
